intro: Ormosia travancorica, commonly known as Travancore ormosia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, tropical forests and is adapted to the humid climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
